additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: This tool kit icnlude draw knives, rasps, scrapers, basic fletching, twine/sinue, some tallow glue, fletching rig, hatchet and rat tail file.

additionalEntries.name: History
entries: When you attempt to identify an arrow you are more likely to know something about the history of the creator or its user.

additionalEntries.name: Intelligence
entries: You can make an intelligence check to indentify properties of bows/crossbow and arrows/bolt (or pellets/bullets if Gunsmithing).

additionalEntries.name: Skilled Craftman
entries: You can use this tool proficiency to create specialized (Uncommon) arrows and bolts, and masterwork Crossbows & Bows. You may add your proficiency to the daily work value in gp.

additionalEntries.name: Archer's Paradox
entries: Targets behind 3/4 or less cover do not benefit from any AC bonus from the cover, and prone creatures beyond 5 ft do not impose disadvantage.

item.name: Hunter's Pack (variant)
additionalEntries: The Hunter's pack is useful for rendering and field dressing creatures they slay. Harvesting bits and pieces of the creature for food, arcane rites, alchemical reagents, or smithing.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: This leather tool bag has all you need to field dress your kill. The kit includes 25 ft of rope, leather gloves, gut hook knife, bowie butcher knife, whetstone, shears, bone saw, crowbar, tongs, pliers, mincing knife, blubber fork, bone spade (to be used with a branch or pole), a hunting trap, and 10 empty vials for samples.

additionalEntries.name: Animal Handling
entries: When you are working with animals, your knowledge of their weak spots an anatomy makes handling them less challenging - or at least less dangerous.

additionalEntries.name: Artisan Tool/Tool kit
entries: This is a fairly complicated one. {@item Leatherworker's Tools}: works in to help with track and barding for exotic animal and help protect a creature's handler from the creature's threat(s). {@item Poisoner's Kit}: Fosters better preparidness in resistance to poison attacks, and helps harvest natural toxins from such.

additionalEntries.name: Survival
entries: With proficiency in this pack, the character is more likely to harvest useable materials for food, alchemical reagents, extracting poisons or toxins, arcane rites or for crafting mundane items.

additionalEntries.name: Harvesting
entries: You can attempt to procure special items from creaures that you've correctly identified (@ability Intelligence), and remember what parts are useful for such.

additionalEntries.name: Choice Cut
entries: When you harvest for your own crafting or cooking, your ability check are done as if using the next tier quality of materials. otherwise the

item.name: Undertaker's supplies
additionalEntries: An inquisitor's Kit helps the Inquistitor investigate.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Small amount of cosmetics, syphon, syringe, dyes, thread, needle, paste, saw, sharp knife, Measureing string, cotton wads and rags.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation
entries: When you search a body, your proficiency helps you identify key markers and locate clues for a body's tell-tale sign of what killed the creature..

additionalEntries.name: Perception/Deception
entries: Skilled users more likely to detect intelligent undead that are attempting to look like the living (and more capable of making the (un)dead appear to be living. This tool proficiency can be used to hide the cause of death in creature.

additionalEntries.name: Embalming
entries: You can use this tool proficiency to preserve a body. On a successful ability check {@spell Revify}, {@spell Raise Dead}, etc benefit from using a prepared body. Animated dead that are correctly embalmed, are granted +7 hp, and may be (as mentioned above) disguised as the living in a more successful effrt.

item.name: Tattoo Artists Tools
entries: This includes a set of bowls, pots, lids, a needle set, medical supplies for 1 application, straight razor for shaving the area, wood alcohol, clean rag, gloves and normal ink nib to transfer/sketch the design on to the subject.

item.name: Full Ink set
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This includes a set of all non magical colored inks.

item.name: Adamantine Plate
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): These attached components act as plate armor, granting the Warforge DR 2 (This does not stack with other DR)

item.name: Alchemical Atomizer
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A warforged can stow one alchemical item that can be applied to a weapon (such as alchemical silver or inferno oil) within the alchemical atomizer. As your free object interaction action, as part of an attack, the warforged can use the alchemical item stowed in the alchemical atomizer on the weapon being held. This consumes the item as usual.

item.name: Armblade
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This large metal cylinder with a heavy, serrated sword blade at one end attaches to a warforged. It fits over the hand and forearm. An armblade is a {@item short sword}, and is considered magical, and requires the Exotic Weapon Proficiency to use it properly. While the weapon is attached, the warforged cannot be disarmed, but the warforged also cannot use that hand for other tasks without removing the armblade. In addition, the wielder gains a advantage against grapple attempts against it. If the wielder uses a ready action to set an armblade against a charge, he deals Critical damage on a successful hit against a charging character.

item.name: Armbow
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This repeating light crossbow that counts as a magical weapon, and is formed from densewood with an unusually thick and rounded stock. It attaches to the arm of a warforged, completely covering the hand. This component only operates when attached and locked in place. An armbow magically loads and fires with a thought, as an attack. The weapon creates bolts from the host's vitality, whenever one bolt is fired, another one is magically created. It can create 20 bolts per short rest. Bolts cost 1 hit point to create and maynot be remove or used by another weapon (even another Armbow). At any time, the warforged can expend 3 hit points to create a bolt that is aligned as if he had cast align weapon on it. Creating a bolt is a free action. Bolts vanish if they are removed from the armbow without being shot. Hit points used to create a bolt are treated just as if the character took damage; they can be healed or repaired normally. An armbow cannot use normal bolts (either magical or mundane); it is designed to create and fire its own magical bolts.

item.name: Automated Repairs
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): With this body augmentation the warforged installs automated systems under it platting that automatically repairs its body. This grants +2 HP per HD/Level of the creature at the end of each Short Rest. This works for the warforged unhindered by the warforged's lack of natural healing and resistance to conjuration(healing) spells.

item.name: Battlefist
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This weapon resembles a massively oversized spiked gauntlet; one designed for a Medium warforged looks like a gauntlet designed for an ogre. It attaches to the arm of a warforged, completely covering the hand. This component only operates when attached and locked in place. A battlefist increases the damage dealt by the character’s natural slam attack by the next higher die of damage (bludgeoning). Versions with magical enhancement bonuses are less common. A warforged monk who uses a battlefist deals increased unarmed damage by one die step, and he can add the battle fist’s enhancement bonus to his unarmed attack and damage rolls. The weapon is not considered magical for its base price.

item.name: Bladed Hands
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A warforged who chooses the bladed hands augmentation installs a retractable spade shaped adamantine blade on the back of each of his hands. When the blades are out, they grant him a burrow speed of 5 and the ability to use the blades as improvised weapons. The blades do 1d6 slashing damage.

item.name: Camoflaged Compartment
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A warforged camouflaged compartment is a magically created compartment designed to appear exactly like the surrounding body part. This compartment creates an extra-dimensional space within the body of the warforged, where the warforged can store items. Camouflaged compartments were designed originally for the smuggling of contraband inside warforged slaves or to aid in the concealment of dangerous weapons. These compartments are traditionally found hidden in a warforged's chest, torso, or upper leg, and is a ten-cubic-foot space that holds up to 50 pounds. The opening face is no more than six inches across. Camouflaged compartments are extradimensional spaces hidden on a warforged body, requiring a DC 20 Investigation check to find. Once an item is placed within the compartment, it is warded by a NonDetection/Nystul's magic aura spell, making it invisible to traditional means to detect magic.

item.name: Command Circlet
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Once granted by Breland to warforged who exhibited extreme bravery and excellent strategic acumen, the command circlet was an honorific reward often accompanied by an increase in rank. This gold band fits easily over the brow of a warforged, fusing there and occupying space on the body as a magic helm. Only two dozen were originally made, but since the Last War, those few have been joined by command circlets created by the warforged of the Mournland. A warforged wearing a command circlet can telepathically speak to any other warforged within 100 feet as a free action (though the circlet does not grant the ability to hear mental replies). The wearer must be able to see the warforged that he wishes to speak to; if multiple warforged are in range, the wearer may speak to them all at the same time or deliver different messages to individuals or groups as time allows. In addition, once per day, the circlet can be used to cast remove fear upon up to ten warforged within 30 feet of the wearer (including the wearer, if desired).

item.name: Disc of Energy Resistance, Greater
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A metallic disc, engraved with runes and set with a gemstone at it center, it occupies the same spot as an amulet on a warforged and grants the wearer resistance to one kind of energy (acid, cold, electric, fire, thunder, radiant, necrotic).

item.name: Disc of Energy Resistance, Major
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A metallic disc, engraved with runes and set with a gemstone at it center, it occupies the same spot as an amulet on a warforged and grants the wearer DR4 to one kind of energy (acid, cold, electric, fire, thunder, radiant, necrotic).

item.name: Disc of Energy Resistance, Minor
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A metallic disc, engraved with runes and set with a gemstone at it center, it occupies the same spot as an amulet on a warforged and grants the wearer DR2 to one kind of energy (acid, cold, electric, fire, thunder, radiant, necrotic).

item.name: Disc of Illumination
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This shimmering metal disc occupies the same body slot as an amulet. Once per long rest the disc causes the the non wooden parts of the warforged body to glow, making them shime as the daylight spell for one hour. When the warforged is illuminated he is difficult to look directly at and gains a +2 concealment bonus to AC.

item.name: Essence of the Guard
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This dull coppery disk bears symbols representing watchfulness. When embedded in a warforged, it occupies space on the body as an amulet, granting the character either expertise in perception (if they are proficient) or a +5 bonus to passive perception if they are not proficient in Perception.

item.name: Essence of the Guard, Greater
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This dull coppery disk bears symbols representing watchfulness. When embedded in a warforged, it occupies space on the body as an amulet, granting the creature a +10 bonus to passive perception Perception, and You gain advantage on initiative rolls. Other creatures don't gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being hidden from you.

item.name: Essence of the Guard, Improved
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This dull coppery disk bears symbols representing watchfulness. When embedded in a warforged, it occupies space on the body as an amulet, granting the creature a +10 bonus to passive perception Perception, and You gain a +2 bonus to initiative.

item.name: Essence of the Spy
entries: {@bold Features} (GM):  This dull grey disk, when inserted into the inner mechanics of a warforged, occupies the same item slot as an amulet and exudes an illusory disguise over the warforged when mentally activated as a standard action. This effect functions as the disguise self spell.

item.name: Finger Picks
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): With a faint click, a series of slender wires, probes, and picks slide from the tips of your fingers.

item.name: Finger Picks (Masterwork)
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): With a faint click, a series of slender wires, probes, and picks slide from the tips of your fingers. These delicate, intricate tools function as masterwork thieves’ tools that grant adavantage on Tool checks

item.name: Fins
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A warforged who chooses the fins augmentation installs a number of retractable fins on its sides and limbs that provide a swim speed equal to  (its base lands speed + 10) and grants advantage on althethic checks for swimming.

item.name: Monocle of the Ebon Hunter, Greater
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A monocle of the ebon hunter is a coin-sized lens of smoky crystal, set in a wire frame that attaches to your head near the temple. When you have a ranged weapon in your hands and are in shadowy illumination or darkness, the wire frame around the monocle glows faintly red-orange, like embers in a campfire. Peering through the monocle, you see auras surrounding your foes within 60 feet. Bright sparks on the periphery of the aura indicate weak points in your enemies’ defenses; you’re more likely to strike a telling blow if you can hit those points. +2 to hit for targets within 60ft. Also grants Darkvision 60ft.

item.name: Monocle of the Ebon Hunter, Lesser
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A monocle of the ebon hunter is a coin-sized lens of smoky crystal, set in a wire frame that attaches to your head near the temple. When you have a ranged weapon in your hands and are in shadowy illumination or darkness, the wire frame around the monocle glows faintly red-orange, like embers in a campfire. Peering through the monocle, you see auras surrounding your foes within 60 feet. Bright sparks on the periphery of the aura indicate weak points in your enemies’ defenses; you’re more likely to strike a telling blow if you can hit those points. +1 to hit for targets within 60ft. Also grants Darkvision 60ft.

item.name: Power Crystal
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This attached component can occupy either the head, chest or hand. A power crystal stores the imprint of a psionic power. You can activate the crystal by spending power points (you cannot augment this power), this power is treated as a normally manifested power with all the attendant effects.

item.name: Projection Orb
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A perfectly spherical globe, resembling a small crystal ball, glints with the same glassy hue as the creature's own eyes. This “item” is made up of three parts: two crystalline eyes embedded the wearer's face, and a matching globe. As a standard action, you can cause anything you see to appear in the globe, allowing its possessor to view what you are viewing which continues until deactivatating the link, which is a bonus action. This does not work through magical walls, across planes/dimensions.

item.name: Psychic Generator, Greater
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This khayldarin crystal cluster is embedded into your torso.  The psychic generator grants you 10 additional power points that can be used each day.

item.name: Psychic Generator, Lessser
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This khayldarin crystal cluster is embedded into your torso.  The psychic generator grants you 1 additional power point.

item.name: Psychic Generator, Moderate
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This khayldarin crystal cluster is embedded into your torso.  The psychic generator grants you 5 additional power points.

item.name: Retractable Blade
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): With this arm add on the warforged adds an Adamantine keen blade that extends and retracts from the back of his hand fast enough that it is typically extended as part of the attack and retracted before the attack is over. The speed of this blade allows the warforged advantage on iniative rolls against any close up enemy who has never seen it’s use before or does not know that the warforged posses it. This one-handed weapon does 1d6 Piercing damage.

item.name: Runic Plating
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): These rune-covered metallic plates are fitted upon the torso of a warforged, fitting almost like a shirt or vest and occupying the same item slot. While worn, your armor bonus to AC increases by +1 and applies against the attacks of incorporeal creatures.

item.name: Scorpion Brand
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Made of a 6’ square sheet of steel edged with gold, this item bears the likeness of a stylized scorpion. Once affixed to the chest, it allows the warforged to manifest an 8’ scorpion tail made of segmented metal. The tail can make one attack as bonus action per round (in addition to any other attacks the warforged can make). This is a secondary natural attack with a 10’ reach. The sting deals 1d6 damage and injects a poison (injury depends on poison used), and is considered a magic weapon for the purposes of overcoming damage reduction. The tail has an AC of 16 and 30 hps, if it is destroyed, the tail cannot remanifest for one week. The tail can make a total of 10 attacks per day. The tail has a special sac that holds the poison almost like a gland.  The warforged can choose which poison he wants to use.  The sac holds 10 doses.

item.name: Somatic Cables
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A small mass of writhing metal cables slides from your chest, twisting about one another in arcane configurations. Developed for spellcasting warforged, somatic cables can be used to execute the somatic component of any spell. This effect allows a warforged to cast spells even with both hands occupied, when its hands are immobilized, or even when grappled.

item.name: Spring Heeled Boots
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): These boot expand or contract to fit the feet of any warforged. Once per short rest as a bonus action, copper coils grow from the bottom of the boots and doubles the normal jump distance of the warforged - OR - for up to one minute (If the warforged is not squeezed) it gains 10 feet to its move, but it may not take the dodge action while using such, as an action they may turn off the boots.

item.name: Stone of Internal Fire
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This item is about the size and shape of a chicken’s egg. The warforged ingests the component and thereafter it is incorporated inside of his internal workings. Once per day, the warforged becomes incredibly hot for 5 rounds. A thick cloud of steam erupts from his mouth and created a fog cloud as the spell but with the following additional properties: Creature that begin their round adjacent to the warforged take 1d4 fire damage. Any creature that touches the warforge takes 2d4 fire damage. The stone is active, the warforged has fire resistance.

item.name: Tauric Belt
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This belt of woven mithral threads, etched with designs of fabulous beasts and studded with pulsing dragonshards

{@bold Features} (GM): This belt of woven mithral threads, etched with designs of fabulous beasts and studded with pulsing dragonshards, grants the warforged wearer the ability to transform its lower body into the form of a fantastic leonine beast—a beautiful construct of mithral, steel, and darkwood. The bearer can shift between tauric and humanoid form as a standard action that does not provoke an attack of opportunity. Tauric form provides the bearer with a number of advantages. Wearer's size increases 1 catagory step; and they gain +10 feet movement; The warforged gains proficiency and ability to make two claw attacks as an attack action, dealing 1d4 points of slashing damage each;  as well as gaining +2 Strength (Max 22) and +1 Con.

item.name: Tracker Mask
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): this thin mask is a peaked band of silvery metal with ventlike structures that fall under the eyes when worn.

{@bold Features} (GM): Crafted to fit above the mouth of a warforged, this thin mask is a peaked band of silvery metal with ventlike structures that fall under the eyes when worn. Originally created for use by warforged reconnaissance troops, the tracker mask grants its wearer the scent ability. However, many warforged covet this item because it gives them the ability to smell, not merely those of a creature being tracked. The mask occupies space on the body as goggles and fuses with the wearer’s face when donned, forming a nose ridge with the slatted vents on either side. Grants: Keen Senses: The wearer has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

item.name: Traction Claws
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This magic item consists of a set of large metal crampons and cumbersome clawed gauntlets, all four of which must be worn to function. The items occupy space on the body as a pair of gloves and a pair of boots, but when a warforged attaches them, they fuse with his armor and retract until needed. A warforged wearing these advantage bonus on Climb checks to climb a surface (but not to climb a rope) and advantage on acrobatic/dex checks related to balance such as on slippery surfaces (such as ice or an area coated by a grease spell).

item.name: Vanguard Treads
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): These massive boots have spiked, treaded soles and look large enough to fit a heavily armored ogre. A row of inset amethysts runs around the top cuff. A common warforged component, vanguard treads provide speed and stability to a warforged fighting amid the rubble and carnage of the battlefield. Once attunded these boots resist knockback (wearer moves only 1/2 the distance normally being forced), And the wearer ignores non magical difficult terrain. The tread is distinctive so attempts to track the wearer have advantage and movement while attempting stealth is halved.

item.name: Wand Sheath
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This narrow sheath is embedded in the forearm and hand of a warforged, occupying the space of a bracer. The warforged can insert a wand into the sheath, in the space it functions as being in “hand”.  If the Warforged could normally activate the wand, they still can, and so as a bonus action; this expends a Forearm slot on the Warforged, and the warforged if modifying their existing arm, must spend the downtime required to manufacture the change in their limb.

item.name: Weaponized Chain
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): With this arm add on the warforged adds a  mithral chain dispenser to the bottom of his wrist. He may dispense or retract the chain as a weapon action and he is proficient in its use (Exotic). When dispensed the chain acts as a one handed mithral weapon that deals 1d6+1 damage and has a reach of 10’. The warforged my choose to have it spiked or not making damage either piercing or bludgeoning when he chooses this add on and may change it with a dc 20 crafting check and 55gp worth of work. The chain give a advantage to grapple attempts (but not to resisting grappling).

item.name: Winged Cape
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This item consists of two large adamantine-edged mithral plates attached to a shoulder harness. When the wings are attached, a warforged gains a fly speed of 50 feet. In addition, the warforged gains the ability to make as bonus action a wing buffet attack, even when flying. Wing buffet attack dealing 1d8 points of bludgeoning damage, with such attacks treated as adamantine weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction. Many winged capes have been found, all bearing one of three designs engraved into their plates: interweaving snake coils without heads or tails, feathers like great wings, or starbursts inlaid with gold. What these designs signify is unknown.

item.name: Wings
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A warforged who chooses the wings augmentation adds huge pair of retractable wings made out of living metal. This allows the warforged a glide speed equal to its base land speed provided its not encumbered (moving its speed prior to the .

item.name: Improved Fortification
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Immune to Critical Damage, Speed is reduced by 5;You may only have up to 2 Enchancement Components at a time, and the Enhancement must be fitted to the Creature [Take 1/10 of the cost as the number of concurrent days are used to fit the enhancement to the warforged]

item.name: Leg Enhancement
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A warforged who chooses this body augmentation upgrades the constructed “muscles” in it's legs; this grants it +10 Move, and expertise in Athletics and Acrobatics (Or just proficiency if the creature is not proficient in either skill); you are considered 1 size catagory larger for purposes of encumbrance; You may only have up to 2 enhancement Components at a time, and as the Enhancement must be custom fit to the Creature - Take 1/10 of the cost a basis for downtime days the warforged must themselves spend assisting with the crafting for the fitting.

item.name: Manipulation Enhancement
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A warforged who chooses this body augmentation adds a number of small tools to the tips of its fingers and to its hands that can be extended or retracted as a weapon interaction. It gains profieciency with a tool group of the player's choice, and is always treated as having masterwork tools of that type.You may only have up to 2 enhancement Components at a time, and as the Enhancement must be custom fit to the Creature - Take 1/10 of the cost a basis for downtime days the warforged must themselves spend assisting with the crafting for the fitting.

item.name: Perception Enhancement
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A warforged who chooses this enhancement fine tunes its own senses to be able to perceive the world around itself more accurately. The creature gains blindsense 15ft. Darkvision 60ft, and adds a +2 bonus to perception checks;You have disadvantage against blinding attacks; You may only have up to 2 enhancement Components at a time, and as the Enhancement must be custom fit to the Creature - Take 1/10 of the cost a basis for downtime days the warforged must themselves spend assisting with the crafting for the fitting.

item.name: Vocal Enhancement
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): A warforged who chooses this body augmentation chooses a race and upgrades its voice box granting advantage on charisma based checks with that race. You may only have up to 2 enhancement Components at a time, and as the Enhancement must be custom fit to the Creature - Take 1/10 of the cost a basis for downtime days the warforged must themselves spend assisting with the crafting for the fitting.

item.name: Dead Air Vial
entries: Within this corked vial is a tiny sample of what is known as “dead air.” Heavy, still, and of unknown origin, pockets of dead air becalm airships and smother crews in remote parts of the Plane of Air. When you open a dead air vial, invisible dead air fills a 20-foot-radius area centered on you. The affected area becomes devoid of breathable air. Creatures that breathe air must hold their breath or suffocate in an area of dead air, though sound, fire, and other effects that rely on a stable atmosphere are unaffected. Undisturbed, the dead air dissipates in 1 minute. A moderate wind (11+ mph) disperses the dead air in 4 rounds; a strong wind (21+ mph) disperses the dead air in 1 round. This item can be crafted with a successful DC 25 Craft (alchemy) check.

item.name: Alchemical Preserves
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Each small tin of this specially treated jam contains just enough of the gooey stuff to provide a halfling with a single serving of revitalizing nourishment.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): While any creature can eat these preserves as a standard action, it only affects halflings in a beneficial way. Halflings who eat the preserves recover from exhaustion. Non-halflings who eat alchemical preserves become sickened for 1 round.

item.name: Ale, Gallon
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A gallon of local ale.

item.name: Allnight
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A white wafer of compressed powder

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): This treated wafer dissolves into a chalky paste when placed under the tongue and then gives the imbiber a jolt of restless energy. It eliminates the effects of 2 levels of exhaustion for the next 8 hours; when the drug's effect ends, the user regains the effects of exhaustion and adds 1 level. Allnight makes its users jittery and unable to focus; they suffer a -2 penalty on all skill checks until its effects wear off.

item.name: Ambrosia (vial)
entries: {@bold Required Space(s)}: Alchemy Lab or Kitchen; {@bold DC}: 25
{@bold Description} (Player Facing): A this heavenly elixir, brewed from holy water and blessed herbs.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Upon consumption it grants a +2 sacred bonus on saving throws against necrotic damage, and death saves for 1 hour, including saves to remove ability and MAX Hp damage. Ambrosia affects undead and evil outsiders as holy water. This effect cannot be stacked. You may only have the effects of 2 food items at once.

item.name: Amethyst Candy
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing):  Purple crystalized hard candy.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): If consumers pass a DC 8 CON they Add 1 to slashing damage for the next 24 hours, if not they become vulnerable to Slashing attacks for 24 hours. This effect cannot be stacked. You may only have the effects of 2 food items at once.

item.name: Angel Tea
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A healthy amber with leaves of mint stirred throughout;A pleasant herbal tea constructed from various plants and resources. Mint, lavender, honey, chamomile, sugar - plus other ingredients that make your whole body feel silky and smooth. Both a refreshment and a welcome sleep remedy. You feel your eyelids grow heavy and your body beckons you to sleep.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): The consumer gains Restful Sleep, which allows them to gain the benefits of a full night's rest in 4 hours. Once awakened, they feel completely refreshened.

item.name: Angry Tom's Furious Ale
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A dark amber / brown butter with a thick, creamy taupe coloured head.;A traditionally brewed, thick, dark ale in which black peppercorns are added to the mash and brewed to 4.2% abv.  It is rich, peppery, and not at all infuriating. Other than the natural inclination to enjoy the drink with a thick cut steak, standard drinking rules apply

item.name: Astral Mead
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A sweet sparkling beverage that restores the body.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  A flask has the nutritional value of  full day's worth of food and water. For 12 hours you have a +1 to Constituation checks and gain an extra 2 hit points when using HD for regaining Hit Points (either for a short rest or for Second Wind like class features). This effect cannot be stacked. You may only have the effects of 2 food items at once.

item.name: Banana Milkshake
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A slightly yellow frothing milk drink with chunks of banana scattered throughout;It's thick. It's creamy and oh so bananary. Add chunks of ice to make it a refreshing drink throughout the hot summer months. Child-friendly. The consumer feels refreshened and cooled down.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Allows the user to gain back 1 lower level spell usage.

item.name: Barbarian Chew
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): The Shoanti of the Cinderlands combine lime, crimson galtroot leaves, and some say horse blood to create this invigorating chew.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  Aside from staining the teeth a bloody shade, barbarian chew causes the user to feel stronger, but also angrier. One use of barbarian chew grants a barbarian +1 additional round of rage. This additional round is used first when a barbarian begins raging. If a barbarian does not rage within 1 hour of using the chew, this additional round of rage is lost. This benefit can be gained only once per day; consuming multiple doses in a 24-hour period has no additional effects.

item.name: Bard's Blessing
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A soft palette of subtle reds, pinks and yellows.;The flavours of different fruits hit your tongue but you're unable to describe which it is before it changes to the next.  As you drink, you'll feel it pooling around your voice box, stroking at it, almost as if it is tempting you to sing.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): You suddenly feel like you could sing to the world! You gain a +5 to any Performance (Sing) Rolls at the cost of taking on the Dazed Condition for the duration of the performance, or as long as it takes before you need to go to the bathroom.

item.name: Beer of Eternity
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): This beer is infused with radiant energy that actually would damage undead if they drank it. Living creatures who drink it become invisible to undead for 1 hour. It can also help with drained stats, restoring 2 points of one stat.

item.name: Bilgewater (pint)
entries: {@bold Required Space(s)}: Brewery or Kitchen; {@bold DC}: 8

{@bold Description} (Player Facing): Blue-ish Brown or Jet Black;Made by soaking the inner organs of various sea creatures soaking in a fermented brine, the concoction is the run through a sieve to remove the bones and viscera. The lingering taste of rotten, brackish seafood remains on the palette for a few hours

item.name: Blerry
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Ranging from clear lavender to deep red, depending on the berries;Of halfling origin, this is a fermented juice of berries, honey and spices. There are regional and seasonal variations, each with family variations. Lightly alcoholic, Berry is usually drunk to refresh rather than to intoxicate (though in quantity, this the latter can be accomplished). Some varieties are dry, but most versions are at least slightly sweet, and almost all ideally have a light carbonation. A few variations made for sale to humans are sweeter and heavier, and are used as a kind of dessert wine, but most native drinkers turn up their nose at these.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): The consumer is refreshed, energized and, usually, somewhat cheered. It intoxicates like a standard lager, and takes at least a pint to get the average halfling buzzed -- a good few pints for a typical human, and a dwarf or half-orc would need more. The varieties made for humans are stronger-- like a light wine.

item.name: Blind Beholder
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Dark red with large white bubbles;A drink made from material found only in the Underdark. Tastes somewhat musty, but has an incredible kick; doesn't take much to make the world start spinning.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Anyone attempting to cast a spell while still tipsy or drunk from this drink risks a 50% chance of the spell backfiring. Disadvantage on any Perception checks relying on sight.

item.name: Bloody Medusa
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Thick and red as blood but with green-ish swirls.  Served with a green snake's head on the rim.;Some think that the drink originally started out using crushed up vegetables and fermented alcohol.  Some recipes still do use the original recipe, but have decided to actually add in the blood of a Medusa.  Not only does it taste great for a morning pick me up, but it also grants the drinkers who partake with a special surprise.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing):   Be wary not to go picking a fight in a bar where this is served.. Drinking this concoction is as if casting Stoneskin on oneself.  Creature has resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 hour.

item.name: Bluenose
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Blue;This ethereal drink glows softly and emits a light mist. Light, clear and almost flavorless the drink itself is merely a means to delight in the wonderful vapors from the mist.  Eliminates overpowering smells from being distracting. The pleasant smells put you in a good mood.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Advantage on Charisma checks.

item.name: Boulderhead Bock
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This malty ale has a legendarily thick, creamy head. It creates a pleasant buzz and sense of euphoria that dull the effects of pain and concussions.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Granting the drinker a +1 alchemical bonus on saving throws vs charmed/frightned effects for 1 hour. In addition, a dose of boulderhead bock grants the drinker 5 temporary hit points.

item.name: Brewmosa
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): 2 freshly squeezed oranges from a local orchard mixed with a pint of mead. Second Wind.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Restores Health: Roll 4d4 divide by 4

item.name: Brimstone Brew
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Swirl of Orange and Red, glowing;This odd liquid is a constantly swirling mass of orange and red, and has a faint glow to it. The brew carries a slight odor of sulphur, and is warm on the tongue.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): After drinking the brew, the character must make a DC 8 Constitution saving throw or hear an unintelligible whispering plague them. However, Warlocks and other characters in the service of infernal masters gain a slight boost in their spell powers, with all damaging spells dealing +2 bonus damage, and all saving throw difficulties to resist their spells increasing by 2. Both effects last 1d4 hours.

item.name: Burning Bronze Rye
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This are made in the City of Brass (home to the fire genies/efreet). The bottles are sold at three different ages: aged 15 years, 50 years and 500 years. The drink waters your eyes, chases away cold feelings.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): The drink imbues you with fire resistance for a short time (10 Minutes). This effect cannot be stacked. You may only have the effects of 2 food items at once.

item.name: Burrfoot's Nut Brown Ale
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A full-bodied ale originally created by a halfling named Nedelmeir Burrfoot. It produces a mild euphoria in drinkers that will mellow even the most taciturn dwarf.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  (As the {@spell Calm Emotions} Spell).

item.name: The Stained Glass
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A dark blue mixed drink served with a lemon wedge on therim of a tall slim glass. Served at The Glass Teardrop.

{@bold Feature} (GM facing): If consumers pass a DC 7 Constitution save, they gain +5 to Persuasion for the next 24 hours. If they fail, at a random point within the next 24 hours, they will become {@condition blinded} for 1 hour.

item.name: Butterbeer
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A buttery brown drink with a creamy foaming top;Foaming, smooth to taste with enough kick to keep itself interesting. A popular purchase among novice drinkers. The consumer feels a little more alert and sociable.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  They gain a +1 to Charisma and Perception checks. This effect only lasts an hour.

item.name: Citrus Tea
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A transparent orange whose bubbles sit on the bottom of the glass;An orange slice decorates the side of the glass in which it is served.Tastes of a mixture of orange, lemon and ginger with a vague hint of spice. Travellers and nobles alike ingest this drink when they have stomach upsets as it is known to aid in both indigestion as well as constipation. Is also rather good for helping cure the common cold. Can be consumed either warm or cold.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): The tea cures any minor sicknesses upon consumption as well as aids in any digestive problems the drinker might be experiencing. Also grants a +2 to Cold Resistance for up to 6 hours.

item.name: Clockwhistle's Surprise
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Dark Purple, Glittery;A nice tasting potion that became a widely served drink purely for the fun of it. Invented by Dondaan Clockwhistle, this drink is said to cause strange effects, most of the time anyways.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): DC 15 CON save. Roll on Wild Magic table upon fail, rerolling for effects that directly harm someone. DM can also decide what happens. Effect can not be affected by features granted to Wild Magic Sorcerers.

item.name: Cock Goblin
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A layered mixed drink served in a clear mug. The top half is a stiff spicy red liquid, the bottom half is a thick sweet blue liquid that's almost like a syrup.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  If consumers pass a DC 12 CON save, the next 5 weapon attacks they make that deal fire or ice damage deal an extra d4 damage (if they hit). If they fail, they subtract 1d4 from the next 5 damage rolls that deal fire or ice damage. This effect cannot be stacked.You may only have the effects of 2 food items at once.

item.name: Cortanethic ale
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A herbal ale said to ease the troubled mind*, and help heal the woes of the body**.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): *allows an extra Save vs. Insanity effects at the DM's discretion)  (may allow an extra free HD of healing over a short rest per day.) Not to mention that it is an absolutely delicious ale. To successfully brew a batch of this ale requires a Brewing proficiency check (DC 15). The ale will need a month to ferment, and should thereafter immediately be decanted on bottles.

item.name: Crate of Chaos Mushrooms
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This wooden crate is about 60cm by 60cm by 40cm, with 'Chaos Mushrooms' burned into the lid in Sylvan. It fizzes with a faint magical aura, and smells delicious.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): (The box contains (10) 1d10+4 'Chaos Mushrooms', which are considered a delecacy at Fey dinner parties. If a creature eats one of the Chaos Mushrooms, they must roll on the Wild Magic Surge table (PHB, p104) and are subject to the result. Each mushroom eaten requires a seperate roll. )

item.name: Crazy Al's Gnomish Knock-Out Lager (bottle)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A transparent, greenish liquid that constantly bubbles.;An infamous Gnomish brew known for requiring a waiver to be signed, absolving the tavern and brewer of any damage and/or loss of life before it can be served. It comes in a black bottle, with multiple warning signs written in Common, Gnomish, and Dwarvish. Tastes absolutely foul.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  Upon consumption, the drinker must immediately make a DC 15 Constitution save. If passed, the drinker immediately gains a temporary +2 boost to Strength and Constitution scores (maximum of 20) until the next long rest, has Advantage on Constitution saves until the next long rest, and has Resistance to Cold damage until the next long rest. The drinker is also immune to the drink's effects for 24 hours. If the drinker fails the save, but does not roll a Natural 1, the imbiber is knocked unconscious for 2d6 hours. Upon regaining consciousness, the character has Disadvantage on all ability score checks, skill rolls, and saves until two long rests have been spent. Should the drinker fail its save by 10 less than what is required the drop to 0 hp and start making death saves, on a roll of a Natural 1, the drinker dies.

item.name: Cthulhubrew
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A slimy green color and thick like syrup.;No one knows where this concoction comes from or what exactly it is made from.  Strange monks in hooded robes deliver the drink by nightfall and give it at a highly discounted rate.  Some say that drinking enough of it not only does the desired effects of alcohol but also enlightens their brain chemistry to a high state. The taste of it is like Licorice or Absynth.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Once consumed, the player gets Telekinesis for the next 24 hours.  But in exchange the player hears dissonant whispers from another being calling them to join their cult. Deals 1d6 Psychic Damage.

item.name: Deepminer (pint)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Shiny golden liquid with black foam;Taken from a keg with floating lumps of coal, initial strong charcoal taste followed by delicious warm honey golden taste.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Upon your next Long Rest, your character makes a bowel movement.  You must roll d100 if you roll under the number of drinks consumed your feces contains a small gold nugget worth d10 gold, if not it is a painful coal filled movement

item.name: Demon's Blood
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Black with red spots inside it;A drink preferred by fiends and devils. Made from Cinnamon Bark and of course demon's blood.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): If any other creature other than a fiend, a Tiefling, and a devil drinks this they take 1d10 Necrotic Damage. They also must make a DC 10 Con save or be poisoned taking 1d4 poison damage every hour. If poisoned roll a 1d6 to determine how many hours the creature is affected by the poison. The creature cannot heal while poisoned by the drink.If the creature falls unconscious the poison stops until the creature is awake. The creature can still be stabilized.

item.name: Divinity Intervention
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This is a Fluffy white confection of egg white, sugar, vanilla and holy oil.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): When eaten grants the consumer an automatic success on their next death saving throw within next day.

item.name: Dragon Poison Ale
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Dark Green with Bubbles;A drink made with Poison that can be used to kill Dragons, however the amount used is very minimum that it won't be fatal to drinkers.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Anyone who drinks this needs to make a DC15 con saving throw. On a fail they will be knocked out for 10mins, on a pass, they gain 10 temporary hit points for 10mins

item.name: Dragon's Breath
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Pipeweed in the form of blue nuggets covered in crystals.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): If consumers pass a DC 8 CON save they gain advantage on their next 5 concentration saves for 24 hours. If they fail, they have disadvantage on the next 5 concentration saves. This effect cannot be stacked. You may only have the effects of 2 food items at once.

item.name: Dragon's Milk (Key)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A deep rusty brown, almost black with toffee colored bubbles, almost opaque when held to the light;Brewed in a secretive enclave known who mark their bottles with the rune of Othala. Born of a mixing of an ancient dwarven recipe with skill and flavor from members of all the civilized races and it is even said the aid of a few dragons. This brew has a strong flavor of chocolatey grains, vanilla, bitter hops, and a myriad of spices appealing differently to each imbiber. It is most commonly found in dwarven enclaves and elven kingdoms but has been making headway into the taverns of all the civilized races; though with limited supply this is leading to an overall price increase over time making it ever more popular among nobles as a status symbol.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  This dank brew instantly warms the drinker and produces a profound euphoria. This brew removes one level of exhaustion as well as making the drinker immune to the ill effects of cold weather, the frightened condition, the poisoned condition and damage for an hour after drinking. It also tends to make its drinkers foolhardy as the euphoria and lack of fear associated with drinking it leads some to disregard their own safety, this has lead to bartenders being careful to whom they serve this amazing brew.

item.name: Dragon's Milk (Pint)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A deep rusty brown, almost black with toffee colored bubbles, almost opaque when held to the light;Brewed in a secretive enclave known who mark their bottles with the rune of Othala. Born of a mixing of an ancient dwarven recipe with skill and flavor from members of all the civilized races and it is even said the aid of a few dragons. This brew has a strong flavor of chocolatey grains, vanilla, bitter hops, and a myriad of spices appealing differently to each imbiber. It is most commonly found in dwarven enclaves and elven kingdoms but has been making headway into the taverns of all the civilized races; though with limited supply this is leading to an overall price increase over time making it ever more popular among nobles as a status symbol.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): This dank brew instantly warms the drinker and produces a profound euphoria. This brew removes one level of exhaustion as well as making the drinker immune to the ill effects of cold weather, the frightened condition, the poisoned condition and damage for an hour after drinking. It also tends to make its drinkers foolhardy as the euphoria and lack of fear associated with drinking it leads some to disregard their own safety, this has lead to bartenders being careful to whom they serve this amazing brew.

item.name: Dragonfire Brandy (snifter)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A deep rusty brown, almost black with toffee colored bubbles, almost opaque when held to the light;Brewed in a secretive enclave known who mark their bottles with the rune of Othala. Born of a mixing of an ancient dwarven recipe with skill and flavor from members of all the civilized races and it is even said the aid of a few dragons. This brew has a strong flavor of chocolatey grains, vanilla, bitter hops, and a myriad of spices appealing differently to each imbiber. It is most commonly found in dwarven enclaves and elven kingdoms but has been making headway into the taverns of all the civilized races; though with limited supply this is leading to an overall price increase over time making it ever more popular among nobles as a status symbol.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Deep candy apple red w, swirling orange mist;Aged brandy with a hint of Apple Cider / Red hots.  Smooth. DC 13 Con sv.  Fail = Disadvantage on persuasion and seduction resistance tests, but you're happy about whatever you did.. until tomorrow. Maybe. I mean you DID have fun. And the Tiefling twins were seriously alluring and sexy.

item.name: Drowned Man Stout
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A full-bodied ale enjoyed by orcs and evil humanoids. The living enemies of the orcs would be sealed into a barrel . The orcs find that the resulting beer acquires a heady quality.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): This drink provides temporary 1d4 hit points for 3 hours or until lost.

item.name: Drunken Uncle
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Thick, dark brown stout, approximately the thickness of eggnog;Tasty, mouth-coating, drink that tends to remind the consumer of fond family gatherings.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  Player must make a constitution check of DC 13: on a failure, the PC must reveal one of their deepest, darkest secrets, or must tell an extremely inappropriate/embarrassing story.  If the PC continues to drink the drink, increase DC by one for each pint consumed.

item.name: Dry Heave
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): White;Sour at first, then burns with a vengeance. After taste leaves a lingering effect.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Intimidation +2 for 1d4 rounds. Constitution Save DC 15 or suffer from dry heaves lasting 1d4 rounds.

item.name: Dwarven Drought
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Nut Brown;Served in a deep heavy tankard, the musty oakish odor is inviting to few but those with the affinity to damp basements. Meant to fill the void of the deep dark caverns, brewed with only the finest dwarven barley this is a strong beer for the strong willed.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Increased Intimidation and Persuasion +1 for every 2drinks. Decreased Intelligence checks by 2 for every 3 drinks.

item.name: Dwarven Grave Ale
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): When a great dwarven hero dies, skilled brewmasters are commissioned to create a signature ale to commemorate his passing. It is stored in barrels that have carvings of scenes of the dwarf's great deeds.

item.name: Elephant Bread
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This grey bread tastes faintly meaty and is incredibly filling.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): One loaf counts as 5 days rations.

item.name: Elven battle spirit (Jug)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Clear;A sake Brewed by the Elves, this rice wine is believed to contain the spirits of Ancient warriors, consumed to gain those warrior's courage.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Consitution +2 for 8 hour, -1 penalty to Dexterity saves, +2 moral boost to saves against fear effects, for 24 hours.

item.name: Evermead
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This pale golden liquor is favored by elves. Those who drink it are imbued with youthful vigor.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): It negates old age stat penalties for 12 hours. You may only have the effects of 2 food items at once.

item.name: Eye of the Beholder
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Milky white;An alcoholic drink made by nomadic groups (Goliath's come to mind) in which a hardboiled egg is added to fermented goats milk.

item.name: Fire Ball (shot)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Fiery Red;Have you ever wondered what hell fire would taste like? Then fireball is for you! “Man i chugged a quart of fireball before the dance and the guards were all over my ass  as soon as i walked in.“ Best night ever!. After drinking a fireball shot you feel the hot embrace of hell in your lungs.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): You get resistance to cold damage for the next 30 minutes.

item.name: Firebelly (per flagon)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A harsh liquor distilled by the inhabitants of cold climates. It keeps you from suffering the effects of the cold.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  (DR 2 Cold) This effect cannot be stacked. You may only have the effects of 2 food items at once.

item.name: Firewine
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Pinot Noir;This ruby rich delight is packed with mouth-watering sumptuousness with hints of bramble, blackberry, boysenberry, Don Cherry and Frankenberry flourishes. A treat to eat with beef testicles or lamb spleen escabeche. Also an ideal companion for manic-depression. Shows promise to last longer than your belief in an afterlife.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Disadvantage on Charisma checks for 1d6 hours.

item.name: Flavoured Water
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Clear;It's a nice, tall glass of water, known for hydrating thirsty travellers exceptionally well. A slice of lemon has been added as a nice garnish. The glass is surprisingly clean as well. . You are no longer dehydrated, and you feel like this will help whatever hangover you may have had the next day. A stranger sits down beside you and orders the same thing. You strike up a conversation over your strange, shared taste in this odd environment. After some enlightening conversation the stranger gulps down the rest of his water, bids goodnight and departs. Your realize that you not only do not know his name, but he left behind a small, glass coin beside his cup. You push through the crowd to find him,  but he seems to have vanished.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  The coin is a Clear-water coin of Hydration: when dropped in a glass of any liquid, it turns into clean, clear, refreshing water.The coin turns to granite, and must be given a day to recharge.

item.name: Fuzzy Night
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Opaque Purple;A thick liquid that has a sweet taste, but has a slightly bitter aftertaste. Many patrons enjoy it with a spoonful of honey mixed in to cut the aftertaste.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): After drinking a single mug, the events of the evening will be forgotten the next time the character takes a long rest, unless they succeed at a DC 8 Constitution saving throw. For each additional mug after the first, increase the DC by 2.

item.name: Garnet Candy
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Dark red translucent hard candy.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): If consumers pass a DC 8 CON  this adds 1 to bludgeoning damage for the next 24 hours. This effect cannot be stacked. You may only have the effects of 2 food items at once.

item.name: Ghost Ale
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This drink is popular in the Shadowfell. It is a dark ale that smells of musty soil but it is rich and inviting.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  When you drink it, you become slightly insubstantial (ignore difficult terrain and can move unopposed through occupied spaces). If you drink 3 ghost ales in 5 minutes, you become unconscious for an hour. Your spirit leaves your body. It is invisible, has ethereal and immune to damage (except radiant or force). It can't attack. If your spirit takes damage, you take that damage when you wake up. This effect cannot be stacked. You may only have the effects of 2 food items at once.

item.name: Giftmouth
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Red wine with a dash of purple;It's short and sweet and leaves you light on your feet. Makes you feel smart and attentive. You begin to notice things that you hadn't been able to comprehend before. A popular drink among aristocrats and nobles.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Allows the consumer to understand 1 random language for 1d4 in hours (one they previously don't know or aren't fluent in). They also gain a +5 to Perception or Notice rolls. Once the effect wears off, they will return to normal and if they hadn't learned the language previously before consuming, won't be able to understand it.

item.name: Glass Milk
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Clearish-white;An expensive drink popular among desert dwellers. However, it is not for the faint of heart (or loot!).

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): If you drink this and pay up, you'll be fine and get a +4 to persuasion until you succeed on a persuasion check. However, if you refuse to pay you will be cursed with some form of madness for an hour or until you pass out- this does not apply who anyone born in the desert, since they have usually drank this at least once growing up and always receive the +4 persuasion bonus.

item.name: Glavgalask (Pint)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A golden brown;The translation of this drink's name is an old, orcish curse - one you don't say in polite company. Known for being one of the toughest drinks ever, few people can handle this and not end up on their backside. It is rarely drunk purely for fun, generally it is drunk in ceremonies and competitions.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): The drinker must make a DC 15 constitution saving throw. On a success the drinker is poisoned for one minute. On a failure the drinker falls unconscious for 1d4 hours. If this drink is mixed into food all diseases are removed from it. Any food that has this drink mixed in does not force the constitution save that drinking it straight would cause.

item.name: Glitter (bottle - 2 pints)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Clear with flecks of gold and silver;A sweet, light craft beer brewed from magically grown sugar. It's is often drunk at parties and given as a gift between nobles. Must be bought from the distiller. Will only be sold to those of upper class or renown.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Roll a d20. On a 19-20, the drinker is cured of all non-magical poisons and diseases. A bottle contains 40 drinks.

item.name: Glowglass (Shot)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): green phosphorescent; A gnomish concoction made from glowing mushrooms. Most non gnomes refuse to drink this sweet liquor, most gnomes laugh at this.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Drinker sheds a soft glow like a candle for 1d4 hours.

item.name: Goat's Milk
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): White;Fresh goat's milk. What more could you want (except an actual drink)? Somewhere along the line of your order, the bartender confused your order with that of a travelling monk, a strict teetotaller.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Your bones feel enriched from the calcium in the drink. Your mother is proud of you for making the right choice. The bartender is embarrassed for giving you the wrong choice. He gives you your drink for free and hastily finds another patron to serve.

item.name: Goat's Piss
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Yellow;“What? Eww no of course I'm not going to drink it..What do you mean, a coward?! Pass that here and watch me down this whole thing!”.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): You must roll a constitution save of DC 10 to not get sick from the drink. If you fail you're nauseous the rest of the night, and several people laugh at you (1/3 of bar patrons will not take you seriously, and you have disadvantage on any Charisma checks against them). If you pass you gain the admiration of all of the bar-goers, gaining advantages on all Charisma checks at the bar the rest of the night, as well as a free drink of your choice or a free round of ale/beer for the bar.

item.name: Goblin Grog (pint)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Putrid Green;The cheapest rot gut ale in the land.  This is the stuff that can be brewed with all types of ingredients sometimes including goblin. Taste is terrible but gets the job done.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Any adventurer who drinks this will not regain HP on a Long Rest.  They will be too busy vomiting and feeling awful all night.  Effect wears off after 1 day.

item.name: Goodale
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This gets its name from the fact that it is brewed in good-aligned monasteries.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): It reduces exhaustion. This effect cannot be stacked. You may only have the effects of 2 food items at once.

item.name: Goop
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Goop is a light gray color and mixes well with most foods. A jar of goop costs 40 gold pieces.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): This magical goop, when eaten, causes the consumer to gain 2 lb. in weight for every 1 lb. of goop that he consumed. This is a 20 pound jar. However, if this goop is tasted, it is so delicious that the eater must make a Wisdom Save DC 15 or continue to eat until the jar is empty. Goop adds a +4 circumstance bonus on Cooking skill checks.  Upon inspection, with detect magic, it glows with a faint aura of transmutation magic.

item.name: Gorgondy Wine
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A wine of saphire hue, its rumored to be made from berries that grow in faerie circles or at the outer edges of the shadowfell.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): A gnomish wine that offers glimpses of the past to those who drink it. This effect cannot be stacked. You may only have the effects of 2 food items at once.

item.name: Gravelly Tonic
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This tonic is sludgy, and its scent resembles the tang of iron shavings.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Drinking gravelly tonic causes your voice to deepen and become more grating for 1 hour, granting you a +5 bonus on Intimidate checks.

item.name: Green Fey
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Lime Green;Made from the wormwood root but not sweetened like liquors.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): This spirit requires a DC 16 con save to avoid vomiting, and suffering a level of exhaustion for 1d12 hours the following day

item.name: Gregory's groovy grog (Barrel)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Mostly clear with a light brown hue;Made with a mix of Dwarven Whisky, even Brandy, and fresh lemons. Captain Gregory created this tasty drink, to serve to his crew. This drink will keep for months, making it perfect for a long voyage.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): For 24 hours, you get a +2 to resist the effects of heat, thirst, and +2 against contracting diseases. also gains a +2 to con checks and fort saves for extraneous effort.

item.name: Griffin Nest (pint)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Medium Brown;A shot of Dwarven Brandy with a raw egg in it.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): DC 10 CON save or vomiting ensues.

item.name: Grilled Achaierai
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This 'white' meat is actually pinkish-brown even when cooked due to the high iron content born from its home plane of Acheron. It's rather tough meat, and smells faintly of its smoky breath. It's difficult to obtain achaierai meat as in some places the fiends bodies vanish on death to their respective lower planes, but in places where the corpse survives the meat can be harvested. The meat is tough enough to dull typical iron knives, and so many pre-cook the meat in a slow cooker to tenderize it, then grill it afterword. This is also done because the temperatures needed to properly cook the meat is higher than most, near the melting point of iron, and as such it is often cooked in blacksmith's furnaces. However once properly prepared it is a delicious and rich smoky flavor which 'tastes like chicken'. Care is needed in cooking. If undercooked the eater suffers as if they had been exposed to the achaierai black cloud ability. However when properly cooked the eater gains the ability to use the achaierai's black cloud ability once. Multiple meals do not stack, so a creature can only have one black cloud at a time.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): The type of cloud depends upon the preparation - DC 14 (Fog Cloud); DC 18 (Stinking Cloud); DC 22 - Cloudkill. It lasts until discharged without concentration. The eater is immune to their own black cloud, as are other achaierais. Saves for the Cloud are based off the ingester's Spell/Ability DC (8+Proficency Bonus + ability modifier (if the creature's class has no such ability, use Constitution ability modifier) This effect cannot be stacked. You may only have the effects of 2 food items at once.

item.name: Gut Shaker
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Yellow-brown, lots of body;Made from fermented goat's milk and a proprietary blend of psychoactive deep mushrooms, this dwarven brew preferred by Battleragers is not for the faint of heart or stomach.  It tastes like a mixture of hangover bile and someone punching you in the face repeatedly with a spiked gauntlet.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  You become enraged, as the barbarian ability, but you are unable to voluntarily end this for 1 minute; after the effect wears off, gain one level of exhaustion

item.name: Gutbuster
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Dark brown;A thick dwarven brew, very rarely shared with non-dwarves.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): After drinking this brew, you are resist poison effects for 1d4 hours

item.name: Hangman's Noose
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Yellowish brown;A depressing drink that makes the consumer feel like nothing is working out, almost like a dark cloud looming over their head. Tastes a little salty on the palette, almost like tears.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): The consumer feels a depression overcome him. If they are already depressed, this effect amplifies any anger, resentment, self-pity, sadness or any other negative emotions that cloud their mind. They take a 1d12 temporary penalty to Wisdom that lasts for 12 hours.

item.name: Harpy's Scream
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): In a colour similar to skin, with what looks like very thin skin floating at the top;This concoction, despite its appearance, isn't actually that bad. It tastes a little bit bitter at first, but once you swallow the “skin“ on top it becomes sweet.. and then spicy. Very spicy. Once the drink turns “spicy“

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): The PC must roll an 11 or higher on a STR throw in order to keep themselves from screaming. If they succeed, they will gain a +2 in performance for an hour, but if they fail they will scream for the next five minutes, and probably be kicked out of.. wherever they are.

item.name: Heart of the Halls
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Clear;Distilled from only the most select yellow mould, this sharp-tongued spirit brings vigor and life to any looking for a good fight.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Temporary +2 Str and +1 Acrobatics. +5 against intimidation checks.

item.name: Hellfire Whisky (shot)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Deep Dark Red;Brewed by Demons, Devils, and even Dwarves. It is said that Hades himself came up with this drink as a way to get himself drunk. Primarily Tastes of Strong Whisky and Lots of Cinnamon.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  Drinking this could cause death, partial intelligence loss, or just a slight buzz. The GM should select what is right for their campaign and situation. Before doing so, ask yourself “What would add the most to the story currently?“

item.name: Hop, Skip, & Go Naked
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Light green;A strong Mead that has a very high alcohol content.  Brewed from the best barley, hops, and herbs in the land.  Is known to get the local townsfolk to do things they normally might not do with just one goblet.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing):   Hence the name. Any character that drinks from this must Roll on ANY Carousing Table.  I suggest the {@link https://www.reddit.com/r/DnD/comments/3uunbt/the_bigger_badder_longer_uncut_d100_carousing/}

item.name: Icecap Ale
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): This rare and unusual brew is fortified by a process of repeated partial freezing, during which the ice is continually skimmed off, resulting in a draught with more than 10 times the alcohol content of ordinary ale.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Icecap ale grants a +2 bonus to the drinker's Strength and Constitution for 1 minute, as well as a +4 bonus on saving throws against charms and fear. However, after this initial surge of energy, the drinker gains 2 levels of exhaustion, loses 1/2 their unspent HD (minimum 1) and takes a 4 points ability damage to Dexterity and Strength. In addition, the drinker loses all memory of events that transpired during the 10 minutes directly following consumption of a draught of icecap ale; a successful DC 18 Constitution save negates this memory loss. Additional doses of icecap ale imbibed during the hour following an initial dose cause the drinker to become poisoned for 10 minutes (instead of gaining a bonus to Strength and Constitution) and to suffer all the negative effects of icecap ale.

item.name: Jailhouse Wine
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A violent orange colour mixed with streaks of deep red;Made famous by prisoners who smuggled in goods into their cells in order to forget the monotony of their sentences, the drink is composited of cheap and easy to get materials in order to get you blazing drunk. Has a strong sugary and fruity flavour that borders on the sensation of fermentation. Hits you hard and hits you fast.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  The consumer must roll a 1d6 save otherwise they will be effected with the strong sense of paranoia for the remainder of the evening or for up to 6 hours.

item.name: Jelly Drink
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A greenish drink that wobbles when moved;It's as it sounds like. The drink is comprised of a green minty liquid filled with gelatinous cubes that can either be chewed or swallowed whole. The drink itself is a little sour but with the sweetness of the cubes in contrast, it makes it a rather unique and flavoursome experience. Allows sour food to taste sweet and visa versa.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  Effect lasts for only 30 mins per drink. Disadvantage on tasted based perception during that time.

item.name: Karura's Cactus Fruit
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Grown on the Opuntia Cactus, the Karura's Cactus Fruit is a great source of nourishment and moisture. Each one provides a full days’ worth of nourishment, water and cures up to 1 level of exhaustion due to dehydration. Eating it also grants the eater the effects of the Endure Elements spell. It is only found in temples of Karura that have springs of pure water in them. Growing them takes a skill check Herbalism DC 14. Each Opuntia produces 2 Karura's Cactus Fruit in just 1 day, but does not grow new one until they have been picked. Once picked, they only last for 1 week until they spoil and lose all their effects. They are normally maintained and harvested by temple clerics to be sold. A follower of Karura is normally given a 25% discount after they have paid homage. If they are attempted to be grown outside the temple, they do not produce any fruit.

item.name: Kenku's Claw
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Black with a streak of grey;Served in a curved glass in that of a claw. The drink's warmth can be felt spreading throughout the body. Then what feels like a cut across your chest.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  DC 16 Cons check or shout out *insert expletive*. But gives darkvision comparable to that of a Kenku for 2d4 hours. Roll a 3d6 a 3 causes you to cough up a feather.

item.name: Kind Draught of Silver Tongue
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A milky tasteless odorless poison used to hypnotize and control the simple minded.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): (DC14 - become stunned, and under the effect of Friends (duration 1 hour) after which they are not necessarily aware of who drugged them, only that they were drugged.

item.name: Kingsblood Weed
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Boiling this weed produces tea that will taste delicious to anyone of royal blood but foul to anyone that isn't.

item.name: Kossuths' Kiss
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Red and Flamey;Cinnamon Schnapps with a special proprietary ingredient the bartender lights on fire before serving. Feels nice and warm.

item.name: Kumada Coffee
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Regenerating coffee that heals HP and exhaustion.  1 bag brews 8 cups. 1 cup restores 2 HP, 2 cups restores 1 level of exhaustion. Usuable once per long rest.

item.name: Truth Wine
entries: {@bold Required Space(s)}: Alchemy Lab or Kitchen; {@bold DC}: 20
{@bold Description} (Player Facing): A sweet white win e of elven origin loosens the tongue.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): In addition to suffering the wine's normal intoxicating effects, a character who drinks truth wine must make a DC 15 Wisdom check to tell a lie.  The wine's effects are short lived, lasting only 10 rounds-1 per point of the drinker's Con bonus.  Creature must drink at least 1 glass (8 ounces) of truth wine to suffer its effects.

item.name: Twisty
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing):  White yogurt on top, purplish liquid underneath;Topped in a thick layer of savory yogurt, it is both a drink and meal in one. The drink itself contains the flavours of blueberries mixed in with a helping of spirits.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): You feel youthful, almost as if the drink has taken you a few years back into your past. You gain +1 in Constitution and also gain 1d4 temp hp. The lasts 1 hour.

item.name: The Redheaded Harlot
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Deep amber red and thick like blood;A shot of named after the taverns best lady of the evening.  It is made from fermented berries, Tree Ent Root, and Deer's blood.  The rim of the flagon or glass is also coated in honey and dipped in a red sweet powder that is to be licked before pounding down the drink.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): All who drink this get Advantage on Charisma skill checks/saves toward the opposite sex while in the tavern.

item.name: Thunk Puff
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing):  A pastry that is a cross between light fluffy bread, whipped cream, and cotton candy, it is one of the strange creations of tinker gnomish bakers. Though normally that news is cause for alarm, this food is quite safe and rather tasty, though it has a strange effect on the mind.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): When eaten while thinking of a topic the user gets the benefit of a weak {@spell augury} that does not answer weal or woe, but rather grants a brief vision or thought which seems completely unrelated and often times non-sequitor. However each vision has something to do with the topic at hand, and the answer is often wrapped in metaphor and confusion. There is no failure chance for the augury, as the confusing vision is usually failure chance enough. As augury you get the same answer to the same question each time, though the visions themselves may have subtle changes such as the pink unicorn now being a blue turnip.

item.name: Travera's Tincture
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Phases between a deep orange and bright yellow.  Clear but with silver dust visible when the liquid is disturbed.;A drink made by a dwarven wife who was dying of a terminal illness but wished to take care of her husband even in death.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  Upon drinking any vessel filled with this liquid the drinker will awake warm dry clean and hunger free the following day at noon, with no recollection of any events( because there were none) of the previous evening.  The drink chooses the nearest bed and makes the owner of the bed friendly until the following evening.

item.name: Treant Tea
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Dark brown with green swirls;Served in a tall earthenware mug, this dark tea still has some ground Treant leaves floating around in it to steep. It is advised to drink slowly as not to swallow the leaves, as they leave a bitter aftertaste.The tea itself is quite sweet, but can be further sweetened to taste by putting a few twigs of sweetwood into the mug. It leaves a nutty aftertaste and an uncanny feeling of connectedness with everything made of wood in your general vicinity.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): While slowly sipping the hot tea, you sprout small twigs and leaves from your orifices. As you continue drinking the twigs spread and your skin takes on a barklike appearance. For an hour after finishing the drink, your skin is solid wood, acting like the Barkskin spell, and you have disadvantage on saving throws against fire.

item.name: Warlock's Wasted Patron
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Blue with dark swirls;Burns all the way down, but has an amazing aftertaste.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Those who drink this drink can use Mage Hand (cantrip) at will for the next 24 hours

item.name: Water
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Translucent clear liquid;Just cool plain water.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): You feel a little better and a little more hydrated.
